JobFullDesc: Sr Principal Software Engineering Researcher Remote USASimple, intuitive User Experiences are the foundation for augmenting human intelligence in the world of tomorrow.  As Artificial Intelligence becomes a dominant force in every walk of like, humans will need new ways to understand and explore infinite amounts of data around them.The future is here but less than 2% of all data generated in the last few years has been explored and exploited.  Research Science in our emerging technologies group is all about breaking new ground and inventing ways to help any person or business explore and answer their most urgent questions about how data is related and how it can solve their business problem. Pioneering new ways to drive insights from massively parallel data-intensive Graphs, our mission is to develop a whole new approach to visualizing meaning and value from petabyte-scale data sets across Edge, Core and Cloud as we shape new User Experiences. Our Emerging Technologies team is a focused, fast-paced group of highly self-driven researchers spearheading the latest methods to become the foundation of businesses in the future.  What you’ll achieveAs a Sr Principal Software Engineering Researcher you will be part of a CTO team that will be hands on with design, implementation, and operations of a greenfield initiative. You will be using your experience and influence skills to help transform Dell by delivering an internal peta-byte scale graph-based system for “as a Service” experiences across all Dell products and business segments. You will become a key player in growing the talent and careers of others through mentorship and demonstration of excellent skills, knowledge, and judgement.You will:Be a technical leader across engineering organizations.Be a key researcher and contributor on an Agile development team, collaboratively creating business value through fast paced iterative software development lifecycles.Participate in the implementation, and configuration of platforms and engineering systems that ensure the highest levels of availability, security, and performance.Define, develop, and demonstrate cutting edge engineering practices for the greater organization.Take the first step towards your dream careerEvery Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:Essential RequirementsExtensive experience with GraphQL environmentsTypically, this role requires 10+ years of software development experience with a degree in Computer Science or equivalent professional experienceExpert in systems design for distributed systems.Expert in designing, implementing, and operating solutions based on microservice, API Fedaration and FaaS/Serverless architecturesExpert in developing and implementing highly scalable, high throughput web applications, Authentication/Authorization, and backend systemsExperience with networking, VMs, Kubernetes, and service mesh technologies.Experience working with Agile methodologies, git repo’s and CI/CD pipelines.Other desirable skillsets:Self-starter, and Self-motivated, able to learn and work autonomously.Experience with Graph Databases and Knowledge Graph.Experience with Event Driven Architecture, and API scalingExperience with Cloud platforms, PKS and Public Cloud providersExperience owning services end to end, from concept to continuously serving customers.Able to identify and lead technical efforts driving clarity out of ambiguity for more junior engineers.Here’s our story; now tell us yoursDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow. Our company is made up of more than 150,000 people, located in over 180 locations around the world. We’re proud to be a diverse and inclusive team and have an endless passion for our mission to drive human progress. What’s most important to us is that you are respected, feel like you can be yourself and have the opportunity to do the best work of your life — while still having a life. We offer excellent benefits, bonus programs, flexible work arrangements, a variety of career development opportunities, employee resource groups, and much more. We started with computers, but we didn’t stop there. We are helping customers move into the future with multi-cloud, AI and machine learning through the most innovative technology and services portfolio for the data era. Join us and become a part of what’s next in technology, starting today. You can also learn more about us by reading our latest Diversity and Inclusion Report and our plan to make the world a better place by 2030 here.Dell is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Dell are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Dell will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Dell encourages applicants of all ages. Read the full Employment Opportunity Policy here.
